revised_title: Observations of the Total Solar Eclipse of August 29, 1886, in Grenada
tldr: The author reports on the observations of the total solar eclipse of August 29, 1886, in Grenada. They discuss the difficulties faced during the observation and the confirmation of Mr. Lockyer's observations before and after totality during the Egyptian eclipse of 1882. The author also explains the differences between the old and new hypotheses regarding the Solar atmosphere and the significance of the spectral lines observed during the eclipse.
